title: Wye Valley Canoe & Climb
tagline: Paddle the Wye, scale the cliffs
suitableFor: Active friends or couples who enjoy outdoor adventures and are comfortable with some physical exertion. Some prior experience with canoeing or climbing is helpful but not essential.
notSuitableFor: Those with significant mobility issues, fear of heights, or who prefer purely relaxing, non-physical holidays.

stops.title: Canoeing on the River Wye
stops.description: Enjoy a guided canoe trip down the scenic River Wye, taking in the stunning views of the valley.

wetAlt.title: Clearwell Caves
wetAlt.description: Explore the fascinating Clearwell Caves, an ancient iron mine system.

budgetAlt.title: Walk along the Wye Valley Walk
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a free walk along the Wye Valley Walk, following the riverbank.

stops.title: The Saracen's Head Inn
stops.description: A traditional pub with beautiful river views, serving classic pub fare.
stops.travelToNext: 5min drive to Symonds Yat Rock Car Park

budgetAlt.title: Packed lunch at Symonds Yat Rock
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy your own sandwiches with spectacular views from Symonds Yat Rock.

stops.title: Rock Climbing at Symonds Yat
stops.description: Try outdoor rock climbing at Symonds Yat, suitable for beginners with guidance from an instructor.

wetAlt.title: Visit Raglan Castle
wetAlt.description: Explore the impressive ruins of Raglan Castle, a late medieval fortress.

budgetAlt.title: Hike to Symonds Yat Rock viewpoint
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the stunning views from the top of Symonds Yat Rock after a short, steep hike.

stops.title: The King's Head Hotel, Monmouth
stops.description: A historic hotel in the heart of Monmouth, offering comfortable rooms and a restaurant.

budgetAlt.title: Wigwam Holidays, Wye Valley
budgetAlt.description: Glamping in a wigwam cabin for a more affordable and unique experience.

stops.title: Explore Tintern Abbey
stops.description: Wander through the stunning ruins of Tintern Abbey, a masterpiece of Gothic architecture.
stops.travelToNext: 5 min walk to Old Station Tintern

wetAlt.title: Chepstow Museum
wetAlt.description: Learn about the history of Chepstow and the local area.

budgetAlt.title: Walk along the River Wye at Tintern
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy a scenic walk along the banks of the River Wye at Tintern, free of charge.

stops.title: Old Station Tintern
stops.description: A charming cafe in a converted railway station with views over the River Wye.
stops.travelToNext: 45min drive to Forest of Dean Sculpture Trail

budgetAlt.title: Picnic at the Tintern Abbey grounds
budgetAlt.description: Pack a picnic to enjoy while taking in the magnificent views of Tintern Abbey.

stops.title: Forest of Dean Sculpture Trail
stops.description: Discover contemporary sculptures nestled within the beautiful Forest of Dean woodland.

wetAlt.title: Dean Heritage Centre
wetAlt.description: Explore the history and heritage of the Forest of Dean.

budgetAlt.title: Free entry to the Forest of Dean Sculpture Trail
budgetAlt.description: Enjoy the public art on display throughout the forest.

knowBeforeYouGo.weather: The Wye Valley can experience variable weather, even in summer. Pack layers and waterproof clothing. Check the forecast before you go.
knowBeforeYouGo.traffic: Traffic can be heavy in the Symonds Yat area, especially during peak season and weekends. Arrive early to secure parking at popular spots like Symonds Yat Rock.
knowBeforeYouGo.booking: Advance booking is highly recommended for canoeing, climbing, and accommodation, especially during school holidays. Tintern Abbey often has timed ticket entry which can be booked online.
knowBeforeYouGo.fitness: This trip requires a moderate level of fitness due to the canoeing, climbing, and hiking. Be prepared for some uphill walking and physical exertion.
